website_summaries.verdict: For home gardeners looking to replace a gas-powered hedge trimmer, its entry-level price and lightweight construction are appealing. Recommended for light- to medium-duty trimming.
pros: Corded electric motor is powerful enough for most hedge-trimming tasks
cons: Long-term vibration can cause irreparable parts to become loose
Extension cord should be under 14 gauge for ideal management

customer_reviews.title: Works great...until it stops working
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this trimmer about one year ago. Used a few times through the warm seasons with no issues. Got it back out this week for spring trimming...worked great for about 3 bushes then started having issues. At first the motor would just stop - I thought thermal overload or my hand slipped off the trigger. Neither proved to be true - pretty soon it would stop and start randomly with the trigger firmly held. I narrowed it down to an electrical connection problem between the rotating trigger/handle assembly and the motor. Slightly rotating the handle would cause the on/off action that appeared random previously. Nice feature, but ultimately appears to be this tool's downfall. Will be contacting customer service.
customer_reviews.author: daddyofthree

customer_reviews.title: Love this trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for the first time trimming my 4 yr old pampas grass bushes. For anyone who has grown these, you know it can be a job. My last trimmer just chewed the bush but this one sliced right through even with the bush being wet from all this rain. Very happy with the weight and how it handled since I am a 64 yr old female. I know this will make my summer trimming for my smaller bushes a breeze. well worth the $.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Tame your bush
customer_reviews.text: I needed an affordable solution for my savage garden. This trimmer was able to handle different bushes with no problems. Rotating handle seems nice but I didn’t need to use it. It is a bit loud as other reviewers have noted but I didn’t use it for more than 20min so it was tolerable. Remember to wear glasses and long pants. Gloves can help reduce vibrations.
customer_reviews.author: Aloha Tomasito

customer_reviews.title: lots of bang for the buck....well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: ordered this unit for a big multi style hedge job i won a bid on. Not a typical job i do but was a package deal. arrived in 2 days and well packaged. simple instructions and i have to admit very strong. never bogged down and many of the branches were as big as the teeth on the unit. the button tilt was very helpful for changing the angle of cutting direction. the job turned out perfect and i made my money 20 times over.. the extra length on the cutter helped tremendously to get those hard to reach areas. highly recommend this for its price.
customer_reviews.author: wildrush

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 4-Amp Review
customer_reviews.text: For the last three weeks I have used the trimmer around the house to cut back growing lilac, forsythia and juniper bushes. The largest diameter branch trimmed was approximately 1/2 inch and green .The tool was new out of the box and looked and operated similar to previous trimmers I have owned. The trimmer cuts through shrubbery so effortlessly that I have to make a point of concentrating on safety so I do not accidently cut the cord or injure myself. However, I do find the trimmer a bit noisy and wear ear protectors when using.
customer_reviews.author: New England Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe!!!
customer_reviews.text: The switch latches and stays on and the only way to turn it off is to unplug it. Highly unsafe! I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: This died after about 10 minutes of use. The reason I got it was because it looked identical to a Craftsman trimmer I had that held up very well but this is a different trimmer entirely. The handle and trigger seem identical but the blades are very thin cheap steel, as a result it is almost impossible to get a nice clean cut. So I now have a quarter of a bush with all kinds of jagged edges and stems sticking out. I wasn't impressed before it died, I'm even less so now. Returning to replace with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: P Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Good trimmer
customer_reviews.text: The first one arrived and did not work. I reached out to amazon and they sent a new one fast! The new one worked great and I am happy. Every product had a certain degree of failure. This company handled my issue quickly
customer_reviews.author: Davebee

customer_reviews.title: Best hedger.
customer_reviews.text: I am an older retired Master Gardener. Wielding larger hedgers around in the yard do not work for me. That was the primary reason I opted for a lighter electric hedger. Boy! Was I pleasantly surprised. I used it for a solid 90 minutes and did not tire. The longer blade is a bonus as I can not climb up on ladders easily anymore so I can stay on the ground to get the whole crown and continue doing what I love most, gardening. And thirdly, the electric is stronger, easier cut and well worth the money. So glad I got this one. Made a great choice. Bonus was a great price :)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda J. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to prune back some extremely overgrown bushes that had some heavy thick branches on them. This baby handled them well, cutting through branches up to, and a bit over, 1/2 inch thick. If it fit between the non-moving sections, it got cut easily. I was doing a LOT of cutting over my head and didn't have a problem with the weight of the trimmer. Easy starting, didn't stall or even have a hard time cutting! Very happy with this purchase, it has made my life so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: I.R.Stamper

customer_reviews.title: SO PLEASED WITH THIS; BUY AN EXTENSION CORD!!! See my photos
customer_reviews.text: Have a very busy backyard and needed to trim in areas that have overgrown. I should've taken before and after photos because I have made huge strides using this item. It is good for lightweight jobs. By lightweight I mean, thin shrubbery and light/thin limbs. I had to spend a little more time if the limbs were 1/4 of an inch. Doesn't go through them easily but if you have light limbs and shrubbery, it works rather well. I was able to trim bushes without issue as well. VERY pleased for what I needed. It is lightweight and very easy to handle. DOES NOT COME WITH POWER CORD. MUST PURCHASE EXTENSION CORD.
customer_reviews.author: C. Beck

customer_reviews.title: QUIT WORKING
customer_reviews.text: Used less than 3 hours! NO longer cuts motor runs but cutting bar moves as on piece. stationary knives move in unison with cutting knife. Read warranty before buying ( ALL THE MOUSE PRINT) Don't expect much. Tired of misleading. UPDATE AUGUST 13 2019 received replacement used today every thing worked as stated. Am hesitant not knowing what caused first problem.
customer_reviews.author: L CUT.

customer_reviews.title: Bought larger than I thought I'd need.....Thankfully!
customer_reviews.text: Tried them out for the first time and they worked GREAT! When I was trying to decide which size to order, I thankfully ordered bigger than I thought I needed. The extra length and the cutting size both came in extremely handy. Mine has the twist handle which I didn't try but I can see where it could come in handy. The switches quickly became instinctive and it is well balanced allowing me to work a few hours without tiring. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Junior Clouseau

customer_reviews.title: This Trimmer is powerful and sharp!!
customer_reviews.text: This Trimmer is powerful and sharp...much better than my 2.3 amp Black and Decker trimmer. Caution; this trimmer is powerful and cut through my hedges like butter...which means be carful of your extension cord and fingers, it will slice right through them ask my father-in-law..no joke. This trimmer actually cut through one linkage of my chain link fence.I would purchase this unit again! Enjoy and have a great summer.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: A great unit and you will love the ability to turn the handle, it makes all the difference.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice hedge trimmer. I am glad I bought the 22" as it made for quick work. The blades are very sharp and the ability to turn the handle is amazing. This item sold me on the unit and now to have and use it, it really made maneuvering around the bushes much easier. I am very happy with this purchase. The only issue I have with it, is the it is a little bit loud when it is running, but to solve that issue, I just plug in my work ear plugs and I was fine. If they could make it quitter, that would be fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Scientist

customer_reviews.title: Great company
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, the trimmers burnt up before the second bush was complete. I think we got a lemon. The company was very good to work with. We appreciate their concern for my husband’s well being.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Fox

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to my GreenWorks collection
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth every penny. I was surprised by how light, yet well built this hedge trimmer is, and it was able to easily cut through thick and thin branches. It is also well balanced so it is very easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Servansky

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well built, sharp blades. so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Working well so far. Sharp and powerful. Seem just a bit heavy but not to bad for the large powerful motor. The only thing I am not crazy about is the safety button that needs to be pushed for it to operate- its a good feature but this button is not a nice and solid button to push- sort of "squishy" to push. But all and all it is a good hedge trimmer. Not sure what is gained by buying the much more expensive models- this cuts everything that I have tried to cut with ease. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Niki Allie

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you want quality
customer_reviews.text: This hedge clipper has only been use about 5 times for a normal .20 acre home hedge on one side of front and a couple bushes. It’s already bent and the safety switch thing is broke it won’t turn off unless I unplug it. My other black and decker trimmer I had 9 years before it completely died gears work out. This pos is only a couple months old and it’s falling apart already. I would NOT buy this product ever again. Sure it’s light and pretty but it doesn’t work and bent easily on a thick branch trim. Wish I never bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great for a smaller yard!
customer_reviews.text: Very dependable and reliable unit to trim hedges in my small yard. There is quite a bit of vibration, but this is to be expected. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: FL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - Extra big teeth
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product esp for the price. First of all it is fairly light. The best features are the 22” long blade. It really makes a difference and there is almost no additional weight. The teeth are larger than the smaller standard Hedge trimmers. So this will cut significantly larger branches than the smaller trimmers. It has a button that allows you to quickly swivel the handle and lock it back at different angles so you dont have to get into uncomfortable positions. It had a slightly larger motor than some other competitors with same length blade. This is an awesome hedge trimmer and it was inexpensive. Home Run!
customer_reviews.author: BB123

customer_reviews.title: Should have purchased one of these years ago!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first powered hedge trimmer and boy does it do the job. A little clumsy to use but compared to hand clippers, it's a real time saver! Had no problems trimming and shaping Yews. Adjustable rear handle is nice and long blade length helps to achieve that straight look, Seems durable but only time and use will tell since this is an item that you don't use but a few times a year.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I always had a cordless hedge trimmer and figured they were all alike. When my B&D died I started researching and thought that this would be a good choice. It far exceeded my expectations. With the B&D trimmer, it took me almost 3 days to trim my shrubs(approx. 500+ feet)due to the battery discharging and the lack of overall power. With this trimmer, I did all my shrubbery in less than an hour. Thing had been overgrown due to not having a trimmer for a while. It cut every thing that I tried to cut and never slowed down. I looked for the highest ratings, lower price, and high amperage motor. Money well spent!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elk Chaser

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Use this twice. Will not keep running. Save your money. Learned a lesson. buy cheap get cheap,
customer_reviews.author: SEEJAYKAY

customer_reviews.title: Super powerful, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Super powerful, and easy to use! Cut ALL of the bushes in front of my house, and didnt get stuck once. Plenty of power and reach! This is the perfect length... cutting a 9 foot overgrown holly bushe took minutes! After use, i just spray it down with oil, and store it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Delapena

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight trimmer thats works great if you let machine ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice lightweight trimmer thats works great if you let machine do the work and don't try to muscle it. Sharp blades and no problem with up to 3/8 inch branch. For the price it can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Scarlet Pumpernickel

customer_reviews.title: DULL Blades - new unit - cannot even cut thin yew branches completely
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, no prep needed according to manual, started trimming my yew bush. No thick branches at all, but it wasn't even cutting the end tip branches - all it was doing was stripping the needles. See photo. It worked on my thicker branched Euonymous bush. This is UNACCEPTABLE --- and will be returned. I can only think this is a one-of.... marginal reviews only talk of unit stopping - - I found no mention of these dull blades.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic results on anything up to 1/2"
customer_reviews.text: I've only used them twice so far, but they made quick work of trimming my shrubs and a 12' high fur pine tree. Anything 1/2" or less they slice through like butter and give a clean cut. Above 1/2" they bog down somewhat but this really isn't an issue for what I'm trimming. They were about $20-$30 less than similar models at the big box stores so I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: gman863

customer_reviews.title: Good trimmer for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I used this and It worked fine I have never used an electric trimmer before. It did seem underpowered but I'm also use to 4 and 2 stroke motors. I trimmed a bush and small branches with ease. I definitely recommend and the price was right!
customer_reviews.author: Duke Royce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Can't Beat the Price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for trimming the hedges in our yard, cutting down brush that's about 3/4" thick or less (haven't tried it on anything thicker). Was so pleasantly surprised at the size and excellent quality for the price. My yard is small, so electric works great with my 100' extension cord. A+++ and easy to handle / manage.
customer_reviews.author: VMom

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, great product
customer_reviews.text: I used this to quickly chop down tons of silvergrass and weeds growing out of control. Much faster than large garden shears and much less effort. This is worth the investment. This hedge trimmer is not very lightweight, and once you’re holding it up and pressing against heavy brush and branches, it feels heavier and you get tired. The cord is a bit tricky and gets in the way a lot but that’s how it goes with an electric tool. The construction feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Rumit P

customer_reviews.title: Corded Hedge Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This does a great job trimming. The only problem I have had with this corded unit is that I have cut my electrical cord into twice. I would start trimming the hedges and thinking I was being very careful with the cord and before I knew it, I would accidently get the cord into the blades. It's very easy to start concentrating on cutting a hedge and not notice the cord just for a second. I may consider a gas unit next time. For the money this is a good product and does a good cutting job, but it really needs something to hold the cord out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use this very easily. It helped me tremendously with my yard work! Its a lot cheaper to buy the tools you need then to pay someone to do it for you. The only down fall ,while using this product, is that my cord kept unplugging while I was using it. I would get into a rhythm and be forced to stop.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been happy with the use of this product thus far for trimming my bougainvillea bush, but it only does the smaller branches. Nice product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: G. Spendlove

customer_reviews.title: light and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Shrubs grow fast in the south and I had some that I'd neglected but this little machine went right through them. I thought I would have to bring out my heavy gas-powered trimmer for the larger hedges but the Greenworks did great. Being smaller and light this trimmer was easier to use to trim hedge tops and easy to maneuver to get desired edges. The trigger lock was easy to get used to. I considered more powerful and smaller but this strikes the balance.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Lemcke

customer_reviews.title: It did the job!
customer_reviews.text: I used this trimmer right away since I had a wisteria bush that loves spring weather and was going crazy on me. It did a very good job right away. Easy to handle, good balance, it had no problem cutting through dense greenery. The bush looked great when I finished. Nice tool. Looking for a long relationship with this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Benat

customer_reviews.title: A easily meneaverable, powerful 22" blade corded  hedge trimmer at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this hedge trimmer purchase as a gift. Decided to buy the corded version rather than the battery charger style. since it is usually a whole days work & we didn't want to run out of power during a job. The 4 Amp motor was powerful enough & performed as expected to trim and cut down other large, very overgrown, dying hydrangeas bushes. The 22" dual action steel blade was perfect length for our needs for maneuverability and safety.
customer_reviews.author: ELM.NYC

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy anything from Greenworks
customer_reviews.text: They do not have good customer service. And their products do not work well, at all. Continually stop working at random intervals and for random periods of time, for no reason. Brand new machines, like this one and the lawnmower, about every Greenworks product made. This company needs to stop selling faulty products to the public and then asking them to jump through hoops to recieve help or compensation.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 22-Inch Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Very nice machine. I prune an 8 ft. tall gumbo-limbo to keep it on the short side, plus some ficus hedges. I used a smaller electric trimmer before and did not like the results: it was easier to use pruning shears, which can be a real workout on a hot day. The Greenworks 22 trimmer is exactly what I needed. Strong enough to prune the tree and light enough not to stress out my arms for a half hour pruning.
customer_reviews.author: John Dinger

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a large hedge/bush. It works as advertised and more. I searched all Amazon and Lowes/Home Depot had to offer and it was overwhelming. Finally chose this one as I trust the GreenWorks brand and the price was reasonable. The 22" 4amp combination is perfect for me and it is not too heavy to hold. Cuts through the hedge with ease and that is all that matters in the end. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Perry T Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Great saw blade length and handy rotating body.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. The length of the cutting blade is great; knocks out a lot of hedge quickly. Not too heavy so I’m able to hold it with one hand as needed for the occasional stretch. The rotating body is great; glad I got the model that does that. Really nice to be able shape the face of the hedge without contorting your body or arms. Teeth are sharp as expected; just started using so not sure of durability. I’m not one to put a trimmer to the test on thicker branches so I can’t advise if it cuts a certain diameter branch. I would definitely recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Starts every time. :)
customer_reviews.text: Not too heavy and well constructed. Easy to maneuver and VERY sharp. I baught t his instead of a gas model because there is so much fussing with the gas over the winter and remembering to empty the tank so it doesnt go bad. Best buy for the growing part of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Devin C Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Died after little use
customer_reviews.text: Had to shape 12 dwarf boxwood hedges, each 15'x2'x2'. Died around the 5th hedge. I'm almost glad it died because it wasn't cutting a clean edge, but instead, mangling the branches a bit. This could allow fungus into my boxwoods, which would really upset me. I think it's just underpowered. Alas, I may not be able to handle anything heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Benton Fremont

customer_reviews.title: The Godzilla of Electric Hedgers
customer_reviews.text: Really, this thing is a monster. It allows me to trim my camellias with ease, even thicker branches, like a hot knife going through butter. It's sturdy and seems well-made, relatively easy to control, but a tad heavier than I'd like it to be. The rotation is a nice feature, but I don't use it as much as I thought I would. The only caveat is that it is loud (like Godzilla) and emits a high-pitched whine, so PLEASE wear ear protection when using this thing. Factor that into your purchase, as well as a good quality extension cord. And watch your finger tips when you use it..
customer_reviews.author: Shanghai Kid

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if the plug would stay in
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power and cutting ability at a low price. But it has no provision for retaining the power cord. I ended up "tying it on" with duct tape, and even this didn't hold for long. Main problem is the receptacle on the trimmer is two-prong and most outdoor power cords are three prong like mine-- including the one that Greenworks actually sells on Amazon. Two-prong to three-prong is a flimsy connection at best because of the weight of the cord and the 3-pronged receptacle plug. Adding a third ground prong to the product would be a great enhancement, both for safety and retention.
customer_reviews.author: David Ayars

customer_reviews.title: Short life span
customer_reviews.text: This works for a while but ultimately breaks. Mine had very little use but eventually the safety button became so hard to press in that it was barely usable. Then the motor stopped coming on altogether. I wouldn't recommend this tool if you want something that lasts for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light, powerful and sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for occasional use on bushes in my yard. Seems to be sturdy for a mostly plastic tool. It is light and has a good size blade. It cuts well on soft limbs. Mine came with no blade cover. For the price, I'm good with it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Theo

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, amazing price, even cuts Manzanita!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! A comparable trimmer is $70+ at HD. This one turned a hour + job into 15 minutes of fun! I got motivated and shaped up the surrounding brush and tried it on some Manzanita that it cut through with no problem. Probably not recommended (dull blades) but had to try to see what it could do. Get ya one you won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: veronika tow

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Suprised!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been pleasantly surprised with the quality and power of this hedge trimmer. It's light weight enough for a girl like me to use and powerful enough to cut right through my out of control Bougainvillea bushes with ease. I read the other reviews before choosing to go with this trimmer and I couldn't be more happy with my choice. I use it every 3-4 weeks and can trim the bushes in my front yard in less than 30 minutes. So great when its 110 degrees. No one wants to be out in that for long! The price point is great too. Very affordable!!!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great Performer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last summer when it was on sale, after my cheap POC HomeLite or whatever it was gave up the ghost after doing its usual mediocre job. This October was the first real chance to use the Greenworks. Works beautifully on thicker pieces of Yew and I have no hesitation in recommending this model and brand.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: but this length is perfect for my home hedging needs
customer_reviews.text: I did consider a smaller model, but this length is perfect for my home hedging needs. If I was a professional hedger (oh, to dream...), I would likely look at a longer, gas-powered model, but this gets the job done. The swivel head is perfect for me to try (and fail) to make my artistic hedging abilities shine through. It also allows my wife to go and clean up my mistakes and make it look presentable to the general public.
customer_reviews.author: RMH

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job. Was hesitant on purchasing because of some of the negative recent reviews but went ahead and took a chance and bought it. Glad i did because this hedge trimmers does a really good job on trimming bushes and a small tree i have that needed cleaned up. I purchased the updated version so Hopefully the longevity will be great too!
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Finley

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far!
customer_reviews.text: It has done exactly what I hoped so far. Used it 3 times on some bushes in the back. Even used it against some granite rocks that lived inside the bushes, and haven't broken it yet. Also havent cut off my fingers. Big win
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use to trim the hedges at my house. It cut right through everything I threw at it. It made the whole process so much easier than using manual shears like I'd been doing. I don't know how it'd hold up for industrial use, but as a homeowner, this device works great, and at a great price, too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Light, tough and strong cutter
customer_reviews.text: Have used this brand of cutter for several years. It cuts my bushes which have stems up to about 3/8 inch diameter. Total cutting time annually is about 20 hours; spring and fall. I have been buying a new cutter yearly, because it is getting too dull to cut cleanly by then. I don't try to sharpen it, I just replace it.
customer_reviews.author: CountryBoy

customer_reviews.title: A few more inches sure makes a difference!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a longer trimmer since everything in the garden is maturing. Just like me. No more ladders! Worked great right out of the box, cut my extension cord like it was butter. :) So another seventeen dollars. It's just a little heavier than expected but still manageable. No regrets. Gave my short one to the lawn boys in the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Better than anything I could find at the big box stores.
customer_reviews.text: Thank you amazon for finding the good manufacturers or letting sellers sell great products. We had another brand and it just couldn’t cut it. We only have a few bushes and it was a battle to trim them. We picked up this green machine, and we get the job done fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it! Won’t last!
customer_reviews.text: The device didn’t last a YEAR! We barley used it and as soon as we bought a bigger home on more land and actually needed it... it stopped working! We may have used it 5 times within a year and the one day we needed to use it more than 15minutes it burned out!
customer_reviews.author: TIP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent electric corded trimmers
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with my choice of trimmers, since their were so many choices I went with these primarily because of the 4 amp motor, so far they have performed very well, (about 2-3 hours use) blades are still sharp, I spray with WD40 before each use, have always done this with my trimmers, lubricates and prevents sap buildup, BillVan
customer_reviews.author: William Vandeweghe

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a relatively inexpensive replacement for my B&D. I had never heard of these, but I decided to give it a try. I'm just a home user and I have only used it once, but this worked great. The little extra length is what I was looking for and it helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. M.

customer_reviews.title: This little fella does the job just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I only use a trimmer a few times a year, and usually borrowed from someone for that reason. This little fella does the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had this a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hedge trimmer to replace a still functional B&D corded trimmer that was heavier and smaller than this new one. Can't believe what a difference this makes. I'm a 68 year old guy with arthritis and this helped me trim my hedges neatly and effortlessly. Cuts like it's slicing butter.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernAmazoner

customer_reviews.title: A Garden / Lawn  Must
customer_reviews.text: Products such as this are often so overpriced and when it comes down to it it's more of a matter of price versus reliability and functionality. Well this product nails it. I especially enjoy the rotating handle that helps with some of the more difficult places to reach.
customer_reviews.author: Aurexia

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this after *30 years* of hand-cutting my hedges and wisteria, something I never looked forward to. This zipped through all the bushes and made it easy to clean up the annual growth. It's not too heavy to hoist above your shoulders, but be careful in that it's so flexible it can take out the extension cord without you noticing. Ask me how I know!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Matlock

customer_reviews.title: Poor wiring from manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 45 minutes and then it suddenly stopped. Took it apart and the wire from the switch to the motor winding was poorly crimped/soldered. I cut out the bad connection and re soldered. Took around 20 min to fix or would have had to wait another week or more for replacement during the Covid lockdown. Everything else seems reliable.
customer_reviews.author: kw

customer_reviews.title: Good value, does the job
customer_reviews.text: Having bought a Greenworks 80v lawn mower and snowblower I've been pretty impressed by this company's products. This trimmer has met my expectations. I'm not looking to cut down anything super thick, I just have honeysuckle bushes and some average shrubberies out front. And it has done the job and very well for the price. It cut through my quarter inch honeysuckle branches like it was butter.
customer_reviews.author: J. hollandsworth

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a beaver!
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive tool made clearing brush and vines easy. Honeysuckle and grape were invading my yard and were difficult to hand cut. The trimmer sliced through them like butter on a warm day. My wife trimmed the viburnum hedge with no problem as well. Light , sharp and powerful. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: After buying this cutter the trees and shrubs in my yard looks much better. Its quite easy to use and it works well. Since purchasing this item I have used it about 6 times and each time it i was pleased with how easy and quickly i could trim small branches and shrubs.
customer_reviews.author: kel

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in a go. It works great without any issues to report. Saved me a ton of time hassling with other trimmers. Great product, great price.
customer_reviews.author: T. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play simple!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised! Having chosen the old model, not sure I needed the rotation handle but I'll see. It is lightweight for sure. It easily cuts 1/2 inch branches. I have no reason to believe I will have any problems with this but a 4 year warranty is pretty generous!
customer_reviews.author: J. Keith

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Because i am 66 years old this is a great tool for me. I can cut what little hedges that i have with very little effort. I also love that I can shape my hedges with out having to get tired of cutting them. Great great great hedge clippers.
customer_reviews.author: RoShel

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected. It cuts well, is plenty powerful, has good reach and lighter than I expected. Beautiful tool for occasional use. I've had it for about two years now, and it has kept up with my sizable hedge just fine for that time.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Irrgang

customer_reviews.title: Serial number is a stick on label
customer_reviews.text: I have had this trimmer for about two weeks and I have used it to trim my hedge which is about 60' long. Works just fine. I noticed the serial number is a flimsy stick on label that can be peeled off without much effort. So you are out of luck identifying it if gets stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Recycled

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, I bought this to trim one big shrub that grows like a weed, I have to trim it 3 times spring, summer and fall. I used to trim it with big hand shears, no more though, this thing cuts through the branches like butter, very happy, just be careful you don’t slice through the cord, I haven’t yet but came close. Peace!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great for hedges and bushes.
customer_reviews.text: I have several hedges and bushes that are in need of constant trimming. The length is perfect. It has enough power to cut through quarter inch (maybe bigger) branches. Makes the job go smoothly and quickly. It'll get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: The Baker Family

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate. No issues with plug coming loose. Button start wasn’t a problem and weight is light enough to handle. It cut a holly hedge smoothly. I’m very satisfied although I would have paid more if a cover was included.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L.

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets here🤪👍👍🤪
customer_reviews.text: Very Smooth and durable first time using it. Awesome feature of rotating handle. Dont regret buyingit just hope it last. Everything is made so cheaply now adays. This seems heavy duty and durable. 🤪👍👍🤪
customer_reviews.author: Zakk

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool
customer_reviews.text: To be clear, this tool will not see heavy use in my yard. We only have a few bushes to trim. I decided on this one because I have been happy with the Greenworks lawn mower we bought a couple years ago. This trimmer is light and very easy to use. It does the job we need it to do perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great hedge trimmer especially price considered
customer_reviews.text: I bought this solely to trim some ivy that grows along my back fence once a year. The one time I used it was fantastic turned a 2 hour job into a 30 minute job with cleanup. Love that the handle rotates. Very good product for what I need it for and cannot find a better price for a hedge trimmer, especially for the bar size and hp.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony E.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Trimmers
customer_reviews.text: The trimmers have worked well trimming about a dozen bushes and shrubs. It cuts through a 1/2" branch easy. Like most hedge trimmers, it leaves the larger branches a little ragged but overall, I'm very well satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wood Turner

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: For an electric hedger It really surpised me! I've always used Gas powered ones but this is a dang good hedger for price and it will cut through some super thick hedges! 100% worth the Money, Just dont forget an extension cord which was kinda annoying but worked outwell.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Great price. Good for shrubs and small branches. Lightweight and easy to maneuver and shape small bushes. Only issue is that the cord falls out easily and I’m not sure about it’s longevity (feels a bit cheaply made).
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: NOT capable of 5/8" cuts. The manual clearly says not to attempt to cut anything over 3/8".
customer_reviews.text: Product quality is OK. The biggest issue and the reason why I'm returning it is because it states 5/8" cut capacity. That's false. The manual clearly says not to attempt to cut anything over 3/8". That's a big difference. It also doesn't cut 3/8" very well either.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: Great hedge clipper
customer_reviews.text: My old hedge clipper was dull and worn-out and it would have cost $40-50 and take weeks to get the blades sharpened at my local hardware store. Instead, I bought this new one and it works great for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Richard - 15061

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome for my not-very-challenging trimming
customer_reviews.text: Great price, and it works great. Granted, I just have lightweight trimming needs, for some grass-bushes, rose bushes and shrubs. But it does the job and seems to be well built. I've had it for about 6 months, and used it for a couple of sessions now.
customer_reviews.author: buyerinCO

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to shape a rosemary bush. This tool did the job perfectly. Be aware of the max sizes of the brush you want to trim, but a little over regulation is fine. My orange extension cord worked fine with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ara

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Maybe our old hedge trimmer was dull but this cut through our hedge like a champ. The blade was longer, it had cord management for safety to help prevent cutting your extension cord, and the fact it rotated was a great asset. I use hedge trimmers twice a year. The value is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN  M. HUBBELL

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This is a waste of money IF you have small leaf hedges. It just strips leaves off and leaves the bare stem.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: works super on the ornamental grasses
customer_reviews.text: have some ornamental grasses and tried to cut them this spring with a machete, a weed whip, and a chain saw. found some folks using one of these, decided to give it a try. works very well.
customer_reviews.author: willett

customer_reviews.title: So far so good for the season
customer_reviews.text: Functions similar to other trimmers....however, the "rotating" handle is a nice feature. Have only used it a few times this fall and it works great. Will update my post next year with any +/- comments.
customer_reviews.author: jasmith5

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer!!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works great for my needs. Cut through my bushes with ease. I have a $300.00 gas trimmer and this cuts just as good, doesnt wear me out from holding it. It seems well built and sturdy. No more gas and oil mixing either
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by it.
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought two products (different brands) and received this and opened it up, to test it out. It worked so good, I actually returned the other product - not even trying it out. Was surprised by the power.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy in SC

customer_reviews.title: In a word - Awsome.....
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect at a great price. Mind you i am not a pro landscaper, 6 bushes and a small tree and i was done. I had no problems with the trimmer and It made the job easy!
customer_reviews.author: Steve blahut

customer_reviews.title: Returned when on Off Switch Stuck
customer_reviews.text: the Headline says it all....the thing kept getting stuck when you tried to turn it on... I think it's a design flaw in the power trigger....it 'sticks so you cant know when it's going to turn on.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Cut through the freon line to my air conditioning, like butter! Seriously, this was user error. The trimmer does a great job with bushes and bramble along the edge of my property.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: The ease of use was great. Loved the feature where I could change the direction of the handle. Light enough that my arms didn't get overly tired. Cut great. I would highly recommend this headge trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Noisy...
customer_reviews.text: They work fantastic, but yikes, the shrill noise level when it gets under power is pretty rough. As long as you have good ear protection, they are great hedge trimmers for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sharp and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how heavy and dull my last hedge trimmer was until it died and I replaced it with this. I thought the ability to rotate the handle might be a gimmick, but it was actually very helpful as I trimmed all around my hedge. I'd recommend this product. The price was great too.
customer_reviews.author: CCF

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: These hedge trimmers worked great! I had a Black & Decker unit that had been intermittently going out on me and decided to give this brand a try. These arrived as scheduled and actually worked much better than my old clippers and cut very cleanly and precise. The rotating handle is a great feature also for vertical cuts. Great price and great product. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RAW

customer_reviews.title: Great Hedger
customer_reviews.text: One of the most powerful hedge trimmers at it's price point and it works really well. Light weight, easy to use, and makes not only quick, but hedging fun. Had no problem hedging matured, full shrubs around the house. Would definitely buy again and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Greenworks 22-Inch 4-Amp Corded Hedge Trimmer 2200102
product_meta.description: Size:Tool Only| Style:New ModelGreenWorks offer a range of systems to choose from in corded and cordless tools. Leading in innovation, the corded system offers a variety of tools to get all your yard work done quickly and efficiently. Whether you need something economical or something with greater performance, the GreenWorks Corded System gives you those options without the hassle of gas. Get started within seconds and leave the maintenance issue behind with this Eco-Friendly Reliable System. Choose from trimmers, chainsaws, mowers, snow throwers, dethatcher and more-all GreenWorks Tools are backed by a 4 Year Warranty. GreenWorks 2200102 4A 22" Hedge Trimmer.
feature_bullets: 4 Amp motor to get the job done efficiently
22" dual action steel blade for optimal performance and maneuvering
9/16" cutting capacity perfect for bushes and shrubs
Lightweight and compact design for easy handling
Convenient cord lock to prevent accidental unplugging

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,423 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
